website_summaries.verdict: If you can overlook the small interference issues, Jaybird's totally wireless Run earphones offer a great fit and strong sound.
pros: Wireless, sweatproof earphones that fit comfortably, securely and offer good sound quality
Battery life is adequate at 4 hours and you get two extra charges from the included charging case (a 5-minute charge gives you an hour of battery life)
A companion app lets you adjust sound settings
cons: Some occasional interference issue cause sound glitches
Your ears can get a little itchy during extended periods of use

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud sound cuts out constantly
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, the left earbud will constantly cut in and out. I've reset them repaired them but the problem persists. In addition, the ear tips have stretched out and now will come off easily, even to the point of staying in my ear after removing the earbud.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Lance

customer_reviews.title: Great for Music worthless for Video.
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to review as it depends on your needs. If I was reviewing purely on music listening I'd give these 5 stars. Mine came with the latest firmware update and hence there were no connectivity issues, for Music they work and sound great. If you want to use them for watching video then look elsewhere, they absolutely do not sync the audio and video, you will find many complaints about this on their support site and there is no fix thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Riffster

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose Sounds sport
customer_reviews.text: Im normally a Bose fan. I purchased for 250 bucks the sound sports. To my dismay the left ear kept cutting out. I googled it and found this to be a common problem. I was given a second pair and they also cut out a LOT. I sent them back and ordered the Jay Bird Runs. Not only are they a 100 dollars less, I used them today and they didnt cut out one time!!! You have a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Case unable to hold earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Case unable to hold earbuds. Does not turn off. Customer service has been a complete nightmare. Began contacting Jaybird in June. To date, my earbud and case have not been replaced. Sending back the earbud and or the whole set for replacement would be reasonable for certain companies (Fitbit for example) due to my experience with their customer service. This is NOT in ANY WAY my experience with Jaybird. Please Jaybird, send a case and the broken earbud. After receiving them, I indeed will send you back the case and broken earbud. Maybe a phone call instead of an email requiring you to go into the customer service page. HORRIBLE experience. ZERO stars....
customer_reviews.author: Sasaoti Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things! I upgraded to these from the Jaybird X3s, and expected a bit of loss in sound quality. Fortunately, the sound is just as amazing, the bass is super clean and rich, and hits hard. The app lets you dial in ANY sound that you want, and saves the sound profile right to the buds. The fit is perfect, they don't move no matter what type of activity I'm doing. Don't hesitate to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clayton

customer_reviews.title: The headphones broke twice within 3 months, at first ...
customer_reviews.text: The headphones broke twice within 3 months, at first one of the charging pins got bent, the other time the left bud stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: ziv

customer_reviews.title: Expensive junk
customer_reviews.text: Even with 1.1 firmware the left earbud disconnects every couple seconds. Don't buy these till they sort out the bugs.
customer_reviews.author: James Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great until 7 months
customer_reviews.text: When they worked, they were great. I liked the sound. They are definitely meant for music due to latency for videos, but that is stated clearly when you research them. However, my pair just random started not charging past 80% and won't stay connected after 7 months. They also turn off after a couple seconds now (probably due to the charging issue). It's sad that I paid $200 for a pair of earbuds that lasted a shorter time than the $10 pair I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha Lo

customer_reviews.title: Gave as a gift to an iPhone X user
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to a friend because she doesn't like the look, sound, or functionality of those terrible AirPods from Apple and those Beats are just too bassy and low quality. She absolutely loves these. Uses them for every workout so battery life isn't really a factory and with the included app, the sound on these are incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Bryan Ellis

customer_reviews.title: By Far the Best Bluetooth Earbuds Available
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I have tried a variety of blue tooth ear buds and most don't fit well or have poor reception but these are seriously the BEST option available. They work better than expected, they fit well, and the sound is crazy insanely great compared to the other options out there. Spend the few extra bucks and get a seriously superior product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gusmini

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could still return them
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fine for music, but awful for phone calls. My own voice sounds like it echoes in my ears. The other party's voice is muffled. Phone calls only output in the right earpiece, which is more annoying than I thought it would be. The user interface is cryptic -- short tap on the left ear mean this, long tap on the right ear means that...I don't want to memorize that nonsense. The buttons are hard to use when they're in your ear. The only nice thing I can say is that -- unlike the much easier to use AirPods -- they stay in my ear. These will make me go back to wired earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty ok headphones
customer_reviews.text: Pretty ok headphones. It's nice being truely wireless. However there are some major drawbacks. The biggest drawback being the audio delay from the device. It makes watching videos or basically doing anything other than listening to music or an audiobook impossible. The ear fin fit is also much worse than previous versions. The included tips once again suck. Unfortunately due to the product design, my foam comply tips don't stay on and are rendered useless. Looking forward to Future iterations. For now stick with the X3's
customer_reviews.author: Scoob

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I have had a Jaybird X3 and X4. Both are excellent and, as I gave them to my daughters, I decided to buy a Jaybird Run for my gym workouts and my long runs. I couldn't be more disappointed. The sound, even after using the Jaybird app and boosting the base sound, is flat and much worse than a US$ 10-dollar earphone's my daughter has. I contacted the Jaybird guys and they were efficient in addressing my problem and in sending me a new pair. However, the issues remains. I regret to say that Jaybird will not be my choice for ear[hones for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nilton Silva Branco

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud issues
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds (specifically the left one), are garbage. A possible class action is pending, and I just signed on to it. Search it on the web. I paid almost $200 for these! I was unable to return due to "policy". I have updated the firmware, soft reset, hard reset, and prayed to baby Jesus. When I try to use the left earbud, both earbuds go completely dead from a 100% charged state! Not cool and can't believe Amazon is selling these things! I'd love to see them do the right thing and remove the Jaybird Runs from the marketplace.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Too many problems
customer_reviews.text: i want to like these. The sound is decent and they are reasonably comfortable for an hour to hour and a half walk. However, sometimes they connect and stay connected and other times I get frequent drop outs - every 20 seconds or so. In addition, charging them is a constant battle. It usually takes multiple attempts to get them seated in the case correctly. Sometimes I finally get them in the case correctly and then they lose the connection when I plug the case in. It shouldn’t be this difficult and it indicates a mediocre design.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus L. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase - Enjoy Them A Lot
customer_reviews.text: These are great if you need wireless headphones that can insulate you from other noise, like mowing the lawn. They are great for working out and walking the dogs as well. My only con is the intermittent connection which causes the sound to cut in and out (infrequently), but I can't say with certainty that it is the headphones. I have a Samsung Gear watch and Samsung phone, so I don't know if it is the watch interfering or if it is the phone getting confused with two Bluetooth connections. All in all a great Father's Day gift for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lonney P. Heisel

customer_reviews.title: the most glitchy earphones I had ever used
customer_reviews.text: for about a month they were working fine. I use them with my Pixel3. the glitches started small (like the volume settings randomly popping up) eventually they started disconnecting randomly and even not disconnecting, they just stopped producing sound altogether while still indicating a connection. My music would randomly pause and my voice assistant would come up and then they'd freeze. I couldn't even turn them off without putting them back in the case for a few seconds. worst $115 I spent in my life I do not recommend these earphones to anyone. Stop being cheap and pay another $35 for earpods.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the most important aspect, sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: The latest firmware has resolved the connectivity “issue” and they haven’t dropped out a single time with the iPhone X but the audio quality was literally ruined by this update. The sound quality is that of $25 generic eBay brand Bluetooth buds... I hope they fix this soon because it’s unbearable with technical music. Rap is totally manageable though. I imagine the rap/hip hop scene doesn’t have issues with sound quality with these buds. The fact that their users have been suffering with this quality of sound for half a year is also unimaginable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for casual listening.  These are for working out.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got an updated product or I just lucked out, but I haven't had any if the issues that most of the reviewers had. They provide a great seal which gives great bass response and isolation. I've had no connectivity issues. My only negative is there is some audio latency when using with youtube or other video but to be honest I'm not planning anything watching cat videos while trying to beat my personal best or while doing a HIIT workout. These earphones are made for athletes and exercise enthusiasts. Jaybird hit it out the park for me.
customer_reviews.author: Derwent Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, not great for small ears
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great. No connectivity issues, awesome sound quality, easy to use and put in. BUT. Man. I didn’t know I had abnormally small ears but I guess I do. I used the smallest fins and the smallest bud covers and these earbuds were so painful, especially when I took them out! I wish I had bigger ears; otherwise I would love them. So sad I have to return them. I want to be all in but they are not worth the pain to me. If you have small ears, you might wanna consider something else!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Static/White Noise
customer_reviews.text: Everytime the volume is too low, or there is nothing playing I can hear this constant stream of hissing. This occurs when the earbuds are first turned on and the startup music plays, but then silents off as the sound stops. When new audio begins to play again that static resumes but once the audio becomes loud enough, the static would get covered.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t think they could get better. These buds blew me away
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a user of Jaybird for 5 years. Didn’t think they could get better. These buds blew me away. Fit is perfect, sound great. No issues with blue tooth connection. Looking forward to many years with these! They are a must have! Update: I've had these for over a year now. Use them everyday in the gym... awesome! Charge the case maybe 3x per month. I use them for calls in the car. No issues. The only thing I have to make sure is the metal connectors are free of any dirt. occasionally I put them in the case and one doesn't charge. Just wipe the connector with my finger and we are back in business.
customer_reviews.author: leonard niedosik

customer_reviews.title: I love jaybird, but what happened
customer_reviews.text: sound is good, when it works, I have issues non stop with the headphones not syncing. I will see them connected on my phone but no audio. I then have to put them back in the case and try again. I have had issues where one headphone is working and the other is not. I have also had issues where the volume wont turn up. Jaybird solution to my issues was reset the headphones. I have prob reset the headphones over 20 times now. Every other jaybird I had never had a connection issue. I am going back to my jabras as they just seem to work. absolute fail jaybird!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William G. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Bulky-Not-So-Secure Fit
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with Jaybird. If you're a loyal Jaybird user from the beginning, proceed with caution. These or no where near as sleek and secure as any of my Xs. They feel like studio headphones trying to hang off my ears by the earbud. And because of the bulky fit, the sound isolation is not as good either. Hang in there guys. The perfect true wireless earphones don't seem to exist yet.
customer_reviews.author: BlueOriginRocks

customer_reviews.title: Wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: So I workout at planet fitness, so there is allot of people around. I have found out that one ear bud will go out and come back in and I have my device with me that attaches to the ear buds. Not happy with that. If I stand facing or behind my device, then it works fine, but if it’s not even to my ears then one earbud goes out. Not happy with that. The volume is not loud enough either. Needs improvements on that to.
customer_reviews.author: Gwboats

customer_reviews.title: Straight garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Straight outta the dumpster! DO NOT BUY! I haven't had these for more than five weeks and the left bud is out! What a piece of trash and headache!
customer_reviews.author: Mehrdad Moarefian

customer_reviews.title: Garbage holds more worth
customer_reviews.text: Go ahead and buy Skullcandy's new buds, take the extra $80 you saved, exchange it for pennies. Put them in a sock. Smash your new Skullcandy buds to pieces. You now have an equally functional set of earbuds. These things are the worst buds I've ever experienced. They shut off if you sweat, which is problematic for runners. They freeze all the time and don't shut off or turn on. They require a bulky case to reset and fix this. I can't say how many times 2 miles into my run the just stop. Waste of cash and customer service was no help.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Rex

customer_reviews.title: Useless upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: From the get-go it was obvious that something was off with these earbuds. The left earbud would sporadically lose signal every few seconds and then resume. Also, 4 out of 5 times that I would insert both earbuds in the case, the left one would not charge. I have no idea under which conditions the left earbud would not charge; I would re-insert both earbuds and the left one would only charge at random re-insertions. Returned them fast. Didn't even stress-test them during a workout. Maybe I was unlucky. Maybe I wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Filippou

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones with some faults but 🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for 2 years and can say that they are reliable. However due to having these headphones through this very long time the left headphone disconnects sometimes and I have to turn off and turn on again. Sometimes the headphones don't connect to the phone properly and don't display any sound. I don't mean to complain but there are always faults with a product, but I truly believe that the value I am getting is fair.
customer_reviews.author: Ulises

customer_reviews.title: Left bud constant connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Have owned X2 and X3-both were great (except charging dock on X3 is horrible). Regret going to the Runs. The Left earbud dropped out after one song into the brand new set. Has latest firmware. Attempted reset multiple times. Oh, and the range is poor compared to other JB products i have owned. Garbage. Dont buy.
customer_reviews.author: DrH

customer_reviews.title: Good while they worked, which wasn't long
customer_reviews.text: My first pair lasted a couple of months before the left earbud would no longer charge. I finally got a replacement pair after a couple of weeks, going back and forth with support and paying $15 for shipping of the old pair back to them. The replacement pair was new sealed in the box but I could never get it to be recognized by the app to adjust the EQ and during the 3rd use of them my music suddenly stopped in the middle of my workout. The right earbud on the new pair will not turn on AT ALL now. JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Callmemarc

customer_reviews.title: The issue is that the external button on the case becomes easily depressed, and this apparently powers the headphones back ...
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the Jaybird RUN case has a fatal flaw. After a workout, I power down the headphones and put them back into the case. I then put the case in my gym bag, as I’m guessing that a lot of users do as well. The issue is that the external button on the case becomes easily depressed, and this apparently powers the headphones back on under certain circumstances. So, as a result, I’ve come back to the headphones before a workout with the battery drained, or with the headphones powered on and re-connected to my iPad, or worse, connected and auto playing content, or a combination of the three. Based on this, I cannot recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen9876

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorites by far
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the bad reviews on these buds. I’ve had five previous pairs and these are the best. Once you get the proper fit, they don’t move. I’ve run on the treadmill with them and also outside, no movement. I also love that you can adjust how they sound. That’s awesome. If I could adjust the volume on the buds themselves they’d be perfect. I really like how they automatically connect to the last device.
customer_reviews.author: Jljarmstrong

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give these a try after my X2s died after 4 years or 2/hr a day gym/running use. Very disappointed. It’s hit or miss on even being able to connect, there’s been numerous times where I couldn’t connect and I couldn’t power off and on again, placing them in the case seems to reset them but that’s not practical on a run. (The battery wasn’t even close to dead) also if my phone is in my running belt the sound cuts in and out a lot. Very disappointed after how much success I had with the x2
customer_reviews.author: Erik Bruns

customer_reviews.title: They are great! Love the exclusive adjustable equalizer feature.
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds. I rarely have connection issues and the sound is great. The exclusive equalizer feature, is what makes these better than the Apple AirPods and noise isolation, too. The battery life is good, too and they are comfortable to wear. You have to look at these things as diamonds and not just leave them anywhere. They are easier to lose than a corded headset. ALWAYS put them in the case, when not in use, I found is the best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael

customer_reviews.title: Features, functions & form are solid, but the audio quality is less than stellar.
customer_reviews.text: Except for the mediocre audio quality, I like the headphones -- easy to use, good app, charging case, etc., are excellent features. While the equalizer in the app is a great idea, the headphones themselves have little ability to increase or manage the base level. This is very disappointing given the price point. Consequently, I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Ultrarunner approved
customer_reviews.text: I am an ultra runner and so far they have been able to keep up. They stay in your ear on long runs and have great sound quality. What's most important is they have been putting up with sweat, which is where most headphones fail. Loving this product!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Wells

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t stay in my ears
customer_reviews.text: These did not stay put in my ears at all. Came right out after being put in - even just walking. I could only keep them in while running if I had a beanie on. Tried the different fittings supplied with no luck. The Sound quality wasn’t good because of that. That being said, I’m giving it 3 stars because my husband tried them, they stayed in his ears, and he thought the sound quality was great. I think loving this product will purely depend on the shape of your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: These are the best true wireless earbuds in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: These are the best true wireless earbuds in my opinion. I’ve been using them everyday for the past 2 months and I have nothing but praise for them. I also have a pair of X2’s but they aren’t as convenient as the Runs. I have so much more freedom with them and the music sound quality is really good. I’m glad I went back to Jaybirds and went with the Runs.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Brandel

customer_reviews.title: I didn't believe the reviews and I was sorry!  Don't make my mistake
customer_reviews.text: Fit was fine. Sound was bass-heavy. I'm in a band and use Ultimate Ears in-ear monitors, so I know what sound quality is all about. I thought I would be stubborn and disregard the reviews, but that was my biggest mistake. I get VERY excited when I order things from Amazon and was VERY disappointed when I received them. Money aside, don't waste your TIME and excitement.
customer_reviews.author: Kory Cox

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for someone for Christmas. I should have brought them closer to the holiday, as she could not return them. She did not like them at all. At first I couldn’t understand and then she let me listen to them... the sound quality was just OK but you could still hear others talking and the bass is almost nonexistent. I felt so bad, I bought her another pair by another company. So now, the Jaybirds sit in a box on a dresser, collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Can't have phone in pocket
customer_reviews.text: Bad connectivity with my phone being in my pocket. If any type of body part is between your device and the headphones, it'll lose connection. Awful
customer_reviews.author: William Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice small headset.
customer_reviews.text: I like these headsets, I use them with my Peloton and they work very well, there’s a lag issue, but that’s with the bike. The headset fits well for me, sounds good and doesn’t come loose or anything. Only issue I have is that I’m deaf in my right ear, this makes it difficult to pair, but once that’s done we’re set. The charging case is very nice, I also sweat a lot when I work out, these seem to suffer through it with me.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connection money wasted.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with YouTube fluently. If I put a video and make it go fast , it looses connection ant Inhace to stop the video, wait some seconds play it again and will work , if I switch a video, it will lose connection, if I. Listening a video and have two screens open and do something in the screen that is not for YouTube it will loose connection. Too much money for something that will stop .
customer_reviews.author: Judith C.

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and he loves them! He loves that there are no wires, says the sound quality is great and he can hear his music while on the tractor or while at work in a loud auto plant. Wish I had known about these this past Christmas, I would've bought these for my son instead of the Dr. Dre Beats ear buds, which have a wire.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne W

customer_reviews.title: These air buds are great, stay in as I cross train running biking ...
customer_reviews.text: These air buds are great , stay in as I cross train running biking and push ups an hour long session and they stay in my ears with no slip. I have read reviews saying they cut in and out, I’ve used these while listening to sound cloud for two hours with no interference or cutting out. I used them while listening to music on you tube and cut out twice for a second I hit pause on the app / you tube then play and both buds resumed . I feel it’s the you tube app cutting in and out not the buds , highly recommend as I researched this product for a month before my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The carrying/charger case is great. He uses them every single day
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend's birthday. They did take longer to arrive than expected, but he loves them! The carrying/charger case is great. He uses them every single day. They seem to stay in place and have a sleek style. He says they have a great sound and great charge. His only complaint is the Bluetooth cuts out at times.
customer_reviews.author: norakat

customer_reviews.title: ... came in (after charging them) and these are so cool. I do suggest finding the right tip and ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these immediately as they came in (after charging them) and these are so cool. I do suggest finding the right tip and fin. But these fit great. I lift weights and run and these are surprisingly stable. It shows they are truly made by runners.
customer_reviews.author: Christopherj87

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6-8 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter to use while running when she was at college. She wore them a few time (3-4) as soon as we go them and they worked but the sound quality was only average. This was disappointing but we kept them. She went to college and only used them 2-3 times before the left bud stopped working altogether. Since we were now outside the 30 day return window, and just barely outside the 60 day support window, we appear to be out of luck. I bought a $40 pair of wireless ear buds two years ago and while they are not very attractive, they still work.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled

customer_reviews.title: Earphones that pop out
customer_reviews.text: This is frustrating because I had high hopes that with all of the ear piece options there was surely one that would fit my ear. But I was mistaken. I tried every combination of every ear piece and no matter what, the earphones popped out of my ear, especially when bending over. I feel like my ears are a pretty normal size but for whatever reason earphones don’t seem to stay in. Also they are quite large and stick out awkwardly from my ear not at all as subtle as the picture.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: left side doesn't work, they fall out of my ears
customer_reviews.text: I keep trying to work with these. I've tried every single size of ear insert that it came with. They fall out immediately and there is no sound AT ALL in the left side no matter how much I try to manipulate the settings. Unfortunately, I tried too long to make them work and the return window closed (after less than a month!???) Now I see they are selling for $30 less than what I bought them for. Super bummer- $200 lost on a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Basically the sound is good, you get different size sleeves to adjust fit, but they don't always connect easily to my phone's bluetooth even after re-pairing and if you only want to use one bud at a time, it always has to be the right one. If you want to use just the left one, then you have to keep the right one in a pocket or somewhere but not in the recharging case. I'm guessing the right one is the master for the bluetooth connection. to the seller, if this shouldn't be happening, please let me know and I will exchange them for a new pair. Maybe these are glitchy and I just don't know any better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Left ear plug cuts out, then dies
customer_reviews.text: I hate these ear phones. Since day 1, the left ear plug cuts in and out all the time, and the right one does occasionally. Now, after only a few months of occasional use, the ear plugs turn themselves off randomly without me pressing any buttons and with plenty of battery life. When you are in the middle of a workout, these are very distracting and unnecessary issues. And now, after just four months, I can’t get any customer service or satisfaction from Jaybird because they don’t stand behind their product. Terrible! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Kraig Haviland

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are pretty good. The case design is decent but sometimes ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are pretty good. The case design is decent but sometimes you can close it without the headphones positioned properly. The audio can cut out if your phone is in your pocket and sometimes the left one takes a few tries to connect. These quirks aside, the fit is fantastic (most in-ear headphones fall out of my ear without me moving) and they are great for workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Manik

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is ok, not premium. The connectivity Bluetooth isn't consistent. They are convenient given they have no cord and they do fit kind of flush to your ear. They don't always sit proper in the charging case so you have to check to make sure they are both charging. The function button to do Google isn't always consistent either. The ear tips seal good but sometimes they pop off and are still in your ear.
customer_reviews.author: Joe West

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is fine, the sync method is fine, the crackle and music in one ear constantly is lame. I don’t recommend these to anyone unless they are free and you just need something to use. Sorry, the truth hurts sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ear buds
customer_reviews.text: First set of blue tooth headphones. Pros Excellent sound Excellent quality Excellent price compared to other high end earbuds. Exactly battery life. Excellent fit (with multiple ear pieces for different size ears) Cons None yet. Have been using for about 2 weeks at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Jays
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are awesome. They hold up well during my runs in the snow and rain. Fit is perfect for me. I had to buy separate ear pieces for my wife’s due to her smaller ears. You also can’t Have your phone to far from the headphones or they will disconnect. Maybe around 10 to 15 feet. Great product all around though. The app that goes along with the product is neat to play with. No complaints for the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: great, when they work
customer_reviews.text: These work great, sometimes. Sometimes the left ear bud will go in and out. Also there are times when the left ear bud wont turn on at all. They also don't seem to turn on without the charging base. As soon as I can find replacements for them I will most likely return. I so badly want to love them because when are working they are great, but it's a 50 50 chance.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: They are awesome once you find your correct fit
customer_reviews.text: I tried using comply foam buds and all of the sizes of the other buds and wings provided with the Runs. I was beginning to get disappointed until I tried the large oval gel tips, installed at an angle as per the manual, with the medium wings. These now actually form a suction in my ears now and the sound is very good with plenty of volume and alot of nice bass. They are very comfortable and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: MHLanglais

customer_reviews.title: New favorite headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've only used these for a day but I am IN LOVE. They stay in my ears even when I'm sprinting and lifting, they sound amazing, I haven't had a single connection issue and they're so customizable with the app. I love how tiny the charging case is and how solid it feels. They came charged up so I was able to use them at the gym right away. It took all of 4 seconds to connect with my phone and the app is super simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Nora Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price - Not for running
customer_reviews.text: These are decent ear buds if you plan on using them while sitting stationary. After jogging for 30 seconds, they fell out of my ears. I've even tried changing the rubber inserts. Maybe my ears are weird but I just can't justify spending almost $200 on a par of RUNning ear buds that don't stay in my ear. I wasn't even sweating yet.
customer_reviews.author: J V

customer_reviews.title: No lies...Left connection issues
customer_reviews.text: While the sound is good and the app is good too, the fading in and out with the left ear bud is about as annoying as it gets. I had my phone in my hands listening to a suggested station through their app and this was happening. Funny thing though...the problem got worse once I registered them.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: These little bastards are invincible
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great and have not had a battery problem yet, they will last for at least 3+hrs, anything more than that I haven't tried. The important part here, I put these little guys (accidentally) through the washer and dryer (not in their case) and they still worked perfectly fine after I let them dry for a day. Would definitely buy again but I'll never have to because nothing can kill these things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these daily for a year now, and I am in love! There is a bit of audio latency, and occasionally the sound will drop out in one - but they are far better than any other bluetooth headphones I have every had. They stay in while I work out, and they are comfortable enough to wear during the day at work.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley818

customer_reviews.title: LOVE. LOVE. LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE. LOVE. LOVE! The battery life lasts forever, they fit in my ear perfectly, they drown out all outside noise and when working up a sweat, they don't slide out! I suggest to everyone physically active, purchase these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not
customer_reviews.text: The word "drop" will likely be in your future if you purchase these. Sad they sell them with such terrible technology built in. If it's normal that the left ear but can't stay connected as consistently as these did and every other person that buys them, these shouldn't be sold. At least not with a diclosure. These were terrible. Waiting for the technology to get there. Not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: LoTuZ

customer_reviews.title: If you sweat a lot when you run-look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I've never left a review for a product before. However, these earbuds are advertised as sweatproof and water-resistant and they don't really live up to the claim. About 30 minutes into a run as I begin to start sweating, the right earbud turns off. It is super annoying. I ran a marathon with them, and after the first half-hour they'd randomly turn off every 20-30 minutes. The left earbud stopped working entirely. I'd have to stop and turn them back on again each time. The good news-the charge held up. So long story short-if you sweat like a pig in a dry cleaner bag-look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Schlesinger

customer_reviews.title: Leave the bluetooth headphones to the professionals
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for excellent sound, an equalizer app that lets you customize the sound, great fit and don't mind bluetooth connection drops then these are for you. BUT I would not recommend these headphones or this brand to anyone and this is coming from someone who owned some Jaybirds back in 2016-2017 and loved them. These headphones are plagued with constant bluetooth disconnections even after the firmware update. With the exception of the connection issues these are great headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great start
customer_reviews.text: Great direction for there 1st no wire headphones better then the Bose edition compared to sound quality, but there freedom 2 headset still has the best sound hands down compared to any headset I just wished they could've compact it to these models. For the most parts it definitely works for working out. But if your like me who works out alone and just like to drown out the outside world with your music while you exercise then get the freedom 2 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold V. Tagavilla

customer_reviews.title: Great for the first year or so
customer_reviews.text: I really loved these earbuds. Six months ago (when they were a year old), I would have given them five stars. I couldn't have told you how long the battery lasted, but probably at least two hours. But now, 18 months into owning them, the battery only lasts about 45 minutes. I can't even complete my beach walk or gym routine without the battery dying on me. When I first take them out of the case, they say "Fully Charged" and about 45 minutes later, they say "Battery Low" and cut themselves off. Great product at first, but too expensive to only last 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gadget but lacks rich sound
customer_reviews.text: Been on the hunt for a new pair of earbuds. These are really awesome with the exception of the sound quality. I highly recommend utilizing the app to adjust your own equalizer preferences. This will allow you to fully customize your sound experience. Without doing so these just sound quite flat. I loved the petite ness of them and the charging case is small as well. Only returning them for lack of acoustic sound. Also I’m comparing these to my Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud will not connect to bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: They don't fit great, but well enough to stay in I suppose. If you are a person with long hair don't expect your hair not to knock it out of your ear. Also, the left earbud connected only once to Bluetooth and shut off. Full charged and everything. I regret not just going with air pods.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Molina

customer_reviews.title: New company was the excuse for the poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift but my when my son was wearing them while moving from one place to another one fell out and he loved them so much but when I emailed the seller to try and replace the one or even get a whole set they wouldn't help me whatsoever. I purchased the 3 year warranty but still nothing was done; therefore I will only give 1 star for the mere fact that my son wasn't given an opportunity to fully enjoy them in such a short amount of time and the seller wouldn't even work with me after emails and even phone calls including leaving voicemails.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality product for the price
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue with this product is that the headphones would constantly fall out of my ears if I were to turn my head or bend down. My second biggest issue is the left headphone will cut out very frequently, and my third issue is the sound isn't that great.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Brockhoff

customer_reviews.title: They are great. Comfort is a big factor for me and ...
customer_reviews.text: They are great. Comfort is a big factor for me and I can wear these for up to three hours and not have a single issue. I actually have two pairs of the Jaybird Run ear buds. The recharging car is awesome the battery life is good. The only reason I have them four stars and not five is I think they should be louder. Other than that they're my goto for the gym, outdoors or any other activity that I want to have with me for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Aidenbaum

customer_reviews.title: These headphones connected easily to two ios products
customer_reviews.text: These headphones connected easily to two ios products. It was pretty quick to connect and I coold switch easily from phone to watch for runs. Customer service at jaybird is excellent, I had no problem connecting to representatives concerning issue. The sound of these headphones can be tailored to suit one’s tastes, pretty nice. Only caveat, might be easy to lose these. Edit: Ran these puppies through the clothes washer, twice! They still came out swinging! Durability is on point!
customer_reviews.author: Chubbyghost

customer_reviews.title: Not many Issues, worth the price for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not many issues with this item, has good sound quality, good durability, and quite sweatproof. Battery length seems about (if not) equal to whats advertised, only need to charge the block once to twice a week. My only issue with them is theres occasionally connection issues where they wont turn on unless you put them back in the block and try again, and they sometimes cut out momentarily seemingly at random, which is a miniscule problem. Overall quite a good purchase and would recommend to anyone whos trying to get into wireless buds for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Rulli

customer_reviews.title: Very good wireless earphones.
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot. Still trying to find the best fit as they have fallen out a lot when I garden. The sound quality is amazing and you are able to walk quite away from your device which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Only worth it for listening to music
customer_reviews.text: This device is great for listening to music during workouts and on the run, and I was surprised at the comfort and build quality. Nonetheless, I should have paid closer attention to the previous reviews stating the sound lag when it comes to videos. The sound is always 2-3 seconds out of sync with YouTube videos. Sometimes, the audio would not work at all with say, videos on Facebook, Twitter or other platforms. That’s a deal breaker for me, and likely for most people. Until resolved, I’d say steer clear. Returning these ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Montilla

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable connectivity and poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: They left earbud continues to cut out intermittently which is very annoying. I tried giving them s go, but to no avail. I WOULD NIT BUY THESE AGAIN. I honestly wish I could return them but apparently they only give you 30 days for that.
customer_reviews.author: michael cleary

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for runners!
customer_reviews.text: After reading mixed reviews on these headphones I wasn’t sure- but decided to give them a try since amazon has a good return policy. I’m so glad I did. I use them with Apple Watch series 3 & iPhone 8 to run and the headphones work seamlessly. No issues. Pairing was super easy. Sound EQ is easily adjusted through the app. At this point I’m not sure about the negative reviews but I absolutely love them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One looses connection
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son for Christmas. What a disappointment. He let me know that one of the ear pieces kept loosing the connection, the sound kept going out. Nothing he tried helped. I ended up having to return them.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I like the charging container. The only thing I am not used to is making sure that they are both turned off. I believe turning one of them off should also turn off the other as they are connected. But on occasion I have noticed only one turns off. I can tell because that particular earpiece will connect to me phone when I try to make a call or something. Otherwise I am very pleased with these. My son purchased them and introduced me to them.
customer_reviews.author: TPinkerton

customer_reviews.title: Great for cycline
customer_reviews.text: I wear these listening to music during road bike cycling and I love them. If I keep my phone in the right pocket of my cycling jersey I have no problem with audio cutting out. I changed from included ear tips to third party tips that I much prefer. The sounds is great. The controls on the buds for volume and skipping songs work great. I can't comment on other uses but for listening to music during exercise, I find these to be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: CardinalFan

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: These ear buds are really cool. Great for daily activity. Not so great for working out heavy. Light workouts where you dont sweat alot should be fine. But heavy workouts or running long distance, no. Jaybird Freedoms are way better.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W. Hultz

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfort, and sound.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and feel of these earbuds and the sound quality is great. My only negative is that they drop bluetooth frequently. In fairness, I don't know if it is the buds or my iPod Nano 7 that is causing the problem. Sometimes they work great all run. Sometimes they skip and drop. Overall though, I still think they are a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: V. G. McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I have this 6 weeks but it continues to fall out of my ear regardless of the different sized earpieces. It's just too bulky and heavy. What's worse is theat I'd settle for an exchange with a different model but because I'm outside of 30 days they won't give me that option. I will not purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: ryan spence

customer_reviews.title: Terrible DO NOT ORDER
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the worst earbuds out there. We have previously worn jaybird and they were great. These gave us problems from the beginning. Sound cut in and out constantly, left ear bud hardly ever works and they fall apart while you wearing them! We had to us a tweezer to remove the parts! And to top it all off this seller is not an authorized Jaybird retailer, like they lead you to believer, so it is not under warranty. Do not order theses, or at least go to Jaybird directly, Best Buy or Target (all authorized dealers).
customer_reviews.author: pudgefurt

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, connectivity and video delay issues
customer_reviews.text: Sound Quality is great. The only drawback is the connectivity issues with the left bud. I hope this is addressed by a firmware update very soon. Another thing to take into consideration when thinking about buying this pair is that they have sound delay issues with videos. So it's not an optimal choice for those who are thinking of using such buds for watching videos.
customer_reviews.author: Yazan Al-Weshah

customer_reviews.title: Pass up on these jaybirds
customer_reviews.text: These jaybirds are not worth what they are asking for in price. reasons why I say that is they loose connection between the two ear buds even after the most released update. Sound quality was good only when finding the right EQ Within the jaybird app but out of the box sound it was bad and last for me the earphones did not stay in place even after adjusting and swapping different pieces
customer_reviews.author: Brown91

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay in ear.
customer_reviews.text: While I liked the sound quality, I could not get the right earbud to stay in my ear. Sitting still, yes, moving NO, talking NO, chewing NO. Running - HELL NO. (unless you wear a beanie then they stay in). I tried every different combinations of pads and clips but nothing worked. Sent back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, struggles with connection sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Great for workouts. Ran a half marathon in these and the smallest ear casings were great. Sometimes they lag when connecting and there's a crackling sound. The battery quality can be unpredictable and I get them charging as a precaution because they seem to die quickly
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: they are great. I assume they’ll fix this when they release ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you live in a city. The Bluetooth connectivity in the left earbud is a huge issue that Jaybird needs to fix. Constantly cuts out. Otherwise, they are great. I assume they’ll fix this when they release the next version of the run. But for now, buy their other Bluetooth products which connect from each earbud.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J Gill

customer_reviews.title: Loved the fit & sound but the issue was too much!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted these to be awesome, and after reading reviews about the left bud skipping in and out I decided to try them anyway. But it happened. The left bud constantly shuts off and on, about every 3 or 4 seconds. So awful. I will be returning these unfortunately, and hoping Jaybird fixes this and I’ll try them again. But for now, corded headphones are my alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Nitz

customer_reviews.title: Love the Jaybird wireless pods!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Jaybird pods...Great sound....Can make them fit in any size ear with adjustable kit supplied....Wear for sports and riding bike.....
customer_reviews.author: Patti G.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones. True wireless, they fit in my ear canal and I like how you can customize the sound. I have other JayBird headphones and these are the best yet. It really does take 5 minutes for an hour charge. They lSt 4 hours. I use them at work. Also like I can wear one ear bud if I want to.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela A Barnak

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: Light. Comfortable. Stay in my ears properly due to the wide range of ear pieces. I only use 1 so I can still hear outside noise traffic/cyclist/pedestrians. Syncs well with iPhone and music.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended- highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Came highly recommended. Was highly disappointed. The right bud, which happens to be the controller, would not work. Oh, it turned on and connected but any type of audio playing...nope, zero, zilch, nada. Couldn't hear or be heard on a call. To top it off, they would not stay in my ears. Not a one of the ear adapters would keep them in my ears. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Cassy

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless headphone
customer_reviews.text: Pairing with blackberry took a few trys but after reading online forum through JBIRD i figured it out. sleek design and fit well in my small ears
customer_reviews.author: franni

product_meta.title: Jaybird RUN True Wireless Headphones for Running, Secure Fit, Sweat-Proof and Water Resistant, Custom Sound, 12 Hours In Your Pocket, Music + Calls (Jet)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:SingleJaybird run true wireless Sport headphones, completely wireless earbuds, Compatible with iOS and Android devices, deliver a radically freeing experience to runners. Jaybird run brings incredible, customizable sound in a super-small lightweight Package, delivering a Secure comfort-fit, up to 12 hours of portable battery life with included charging case, sweat-proofing and Water-Resistance. Free your run with Jaybird run - No wires, No worries.
feature_bullets: Jaybird RUN true wireless earbuds give you a secure comfort fit, no matter the shape of your ear, with interchangeable tips and fins
Sweat all you want, push yourself in the rain, and get muddy; Jaybird run running headphones are Sweat proof and water resistant
Jaybird run gives you true wireless earbuds with a mic and a single control button, so you can power your run without breaking focus
NOTE: Refer the User Manual before use

You can customize your sound by adjusting the lows, mids, and highs to pump up your true wireless Sport experience; The Jaybird app can locate your buds if they go missing; Impedance 16 Ohm.Speaker sensitivity 103 +/ 2dB at 1KHz.Output max; 12mW RMS (with level limit)

12 hour battery life in your pocket and fast charging on the go: true wireless earbuds make running with music feel Limitless; 4 hour play time + 8 hour charge case; Output: 12mW RMS (with limit level)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars1,077 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #895 in Over-Ear Headphones#2,125 in Earbud & In-Ear Headphones
